ü•æ How to Choose the Right Waterproof Boot

Waterproofing type:

Gore-Tex is the industry leader for waterproof breathability ‚Äî great in rain and wet trails. 
Switchback Travel

Proprietary membranes (Omni-Tech, etc.) also do well and can be more affordable.

Support & terrain:

Backpacking/technical trails: bigger boots with firm midsoles and ankle support (like Salomon Quest 4 GTX).

Day hikes & mixed terrain: mid-weight boots (Merrell Moab 3, Columbia Newton Ridge).

Faster hikes / varied uses: lighter boots with trail-running comfort (On Cloudrock).

Fit & break-in:

Waterproof boots often take a break-in period before peak comfort ‚Äî plan a few short hikes before big trips.

Try them with your hiking socks + insoles to fine-tune comfort and prevent blisters.

Here‚Äôs a side-by-side comparison of HOKA vs Brooks running shoes ‚Äî two of the most popular brands for both casual and performance running ‚Äî plus recommended picks from each: 
Runner's World
+1

üÜö HOKA vs Brooks: Key Differences
ü¶∂ Cushioning & Ride

HOKA shoes are known for maximal cushioning with tall foam midsoles that feel very soft and plush underfoot ‚Äî great if you want a ‚Äúcloud-like‚Äù ride and extra shock absorption. 
Runner's World

Brooks focuses on smooth, balanced cushioning that still feels soft but with a bit more responsiveness and stability underfoot. 
Today

üöÄ Tech & Feel

HOKA‚Äôs MetaRocker geometry helps guide your stride from heel-strike to toe-off, creating a smoother feel especially on long runs. 
Runner's World

Brooks uses technologies like GuideRails and DNA LOFT foam for controlled cushioning and stability, appealing to runners who want a secure feel without too much softness. 
Today

üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Stability & Support

Brooks generally offers slightly more stable platforms with features that help control excess foot motion ‚Äî good for people who overpronate or want a secure feel on variable terrain. 
Today

HOKA can feel a bit softer and floatier; many love it for long, easy runs or recovery days. 
runtothefinish.com

üß† Durability & Mileage

Some runners report Brooks lasting longer before foam breakdown compared with HOKA, which can compress faster due to very plush cushioning. 
reddit.com

üßæ Summary
Feature	HOKA	Brooks
Cushioning	Maximal, plush	Balanced, smooth
Stability	Moderate	Stronger built-in support
Ride Feel	Soft, springy rocker	Smooth, controlled transitions
Durability	Good, foam may compress sooner	Often lasts longer overall
